title: Citi Wins Risk's 'OTC Client Clearer of the Year' Award for the Third Year Running
summary: London - Citi today announced that it won Risk's 'OTC Client Clearer of the Year' award for the third year in a row. In addition, Citi won Risk's overall 'Derivatives House of the Year' prestigious prize for the second year running.
tag-1: Citi Wins Risk's 'OTC Client Clearer of the Year' Award for the Third Year Running
tag-2: London – Citi today announced that it won Risk's 'OTC Client Clearer of the Year' award for the third year in a row. In addition, Citi won Risk's overall 'Derivatives House of the Year' prestigious prize for the second year running.
tag-3: Honoring the work of firms and individuals in the derivatives markets and risk management, the Risk Awards are the longest-running awards of their kind—now 30 years in existence. The distinguished awards are decided by the editor and journalists of Risk and influenced by the submission of pitch documents and feedback from clients and industry peers.
tag-4: Risk noted that Citi has won "...lavish praise from customers, speaking up on contentious topics and delivering impressive revenue growth. By the end of October, the bank had the largest share of the market's cleared swap client margin—just under $14 billion—having grown 82 percent from $7.7 billion at the end of January."
tag-5: "We are delighted to have achieved this result and to be recognised for our market-leading services," said Okan Pekin, Citi's Global Head of Investor Services. "Citi has managed to excel in the themes that dominated the key markets over the past year. In addition, we continue to invest strategically in our derivatives clearing platform and remain committed to global leadership in this area. We thank our customers who are constantly encouraging us to expand our capabilities and footprint."
tag-6: In the accompanying Risk article write-up, Jerome Kemp, Citi's global head of futures, clearing and collateral, said: "We are very much focused on the sustainability of our clearing business model, focused on sustained growth and remaining a thought leader in the industry. Last year was a good one for us; as of year-end, we had cleared $69.2 trillion in gross notional equivalent in swaps, and $226.5 trillion since we began clearing five years ago."
tag-7: In addition, Citi won "Bank of the Year" from International Financing Review, Thomson Reuters' financial industry publication.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
